The REAL ID Act was passed by the U: S. Congress in May 2005 as a response to the September 11 terrorist attacks.
The Act mandated that every state had to: s licenses that conformed to a national standard by May 11, 2008.
To obtain or renew a driver: s license after the implementation of the Act, individuals had to provide documentation of identity, residency address, and legal presence in the United States.
The U: S. Department of Homeland Security extended the deadline for compliance to December 31, 2009, and many states expressed concerns and resistance towards the law.
